intro: Pedicularis maxonii, commonly known as the yellow monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in open meadows or forest edges. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it an attractive and ecologically significant species in its native environment.
